results.definition: assign a specified (usually proper) proper name to
make a prediction about; tell in advance
order, request, or command to come
examples: She was called into the director's office

results.definition: utter a sudden loud cry
pay a brief visit
examples: The mayor likes to call on some of the prominent citizens

results.definition: the option to buy a given stock (or stock index or commodity future) at a given price before a given date
a demand by a broker that a customer deposit enough to bring his margin up to the minimum requirement
a demand especially in the phrase
examples: the call of duty

results.definition: a telephone connection
examples: she reported several anonymous calls
he placed a phone call to London
he heard the phone ringing but didn't want to take the call

results.definition: a loud utterance; often in protest or opposition
greet, as with a prescribed form, title, or name
examples: She calls him by first name

results.definition: demand payment of (a loan)
give the calls (to the dancers) for a square dance
get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone
examples: I tried to call you all night
Take two aspirin and call me in the morning

results.definition: the characteristic sound produced by a bird
make a demand, as for a card or a suit or a show of hands
examples: He called his trump

results.definition: a brief social visit
examples: senior professors' wives no longer make afternoon calls on newcomers
the characters in Henry James' novels are forever paying calls on each other, usually in the parlor of some residence

results.definition: a demand for a show of hands in a card game
examples: after two raises there was a call

results.definition: an instruction that interrupts the program being executed
examples: Pascal performs calls by simply giving the name of the routine to be executed

results.definition: a request
examples: many calls for Christmas stories
not many calls for buggywhips

results.definition: ascribe a quality to or give a name of a common noun that reflects a quality
examples: He called me a bastard
She called her children lazy and ungrateful

results.definition: a special disposition (as if from a divine source) to pursue a particular course
a visit in an official or professional capacity
examples: the pastor's calls on his parishioners
the salesman's call on a customer

results.definition: call a meeting; invite or command to meet
examples: The Wannsee Conference was called to discuss the `Final Solution'
The new dean calls meetings every week

results.definition: challenge (somebody) to make good on a statement; charge with or censure for an offense
examples: He deserves to be called on that

results.definition: challenge the sincerity or truthfulness of
examples: call the speaker on a question of fact

results.definition: consider or regard as being
examples: I would not call her beautiful

results.definition: declare in the capacity of an umpire or referee
examples: call a runner out

results.definition: indicate a decision in regard to
examples: call balls and strikes behind the plate

results.definition: lure by imitating the characteristic call of an animal
make a stop in a harbour
examples: The ship will call in Honolulu tomorrow

results.definition: order or request or give a command for
examples: The unions called a general strike for Sunday

results.definition: order, summon, or request for a specific duty or activity, work, role
examples: He was already called 4 times for jury duty
They called him to active military duty

results.definition: read aloud to check for omissions or absentees
require the presentation of for redemption before maturation
rouse somebody from sleep with a call
examples: I was called at 5 A.M. this morning

results.definition: send a message or attempt to reach someone by radio, phone, etc.; make a signal to in order to transmit a message
examples: Hawaii is calling!
A transmitter in Samoa was heard calling

results.definition: (sports) the decision made by an umpire or referee
examples: he was ejected for protesting the call

results.definition: stop or postpone because of adverse conditions, such as bad weather
examples: call a football game

results.definition: utter a characteristic note or cry
examples: bluejays called to one another

results.definition: utter in a loud voice or announce
examples: He called my name
The auctioneer called the bids
